Luxelle
Sunday, August 6th, 2017, 2:20:01 AM

Wayback Wagon Warning

Don't get your hopes up in here.

The Polished Forest Green Brig is 20 pounds, 4x, plain brig that's made of vultite. Not a stitch of padding and the analyze doesn't even have any consolation verbs.

... saving everyone's money for you...

Luxelle
Sunday, August 6th, 2017, 2:25:35 AM

On the plus side ... it can be enchanted :)

Alenix
Sunday, August 6th, 2017, 6:20:55 AM

Theres a secret room inside the paint wagon:

[The Splatter Pit - 21860] The pavilion's walls are crafted of deep purple silk, shifting with the slightest breeze. White banners hang from the walls, each one depicting a colorful and detailed depiction of a beautiful landscape, from crisp snowy mountains to lush river valleys. A dark haired human with multi-hued eyes sits near some paint-splattered tables, cleaning some brushes in jars of water. Behind him rises a tall wooden supply shelf. Obvious exits: out

l bann The white cloth banners stir faintly, each one depicting a colorful and detailed depiction of a beautiful landscape, from crisp snowy mountains to lush river valleys.

l behind ban Behind the white banners you see a narrow opening.

go open [The Snake Pit - ] Behind the deep purple pavilion, a sand-filled pit has been enclosed within a border of smooth onyx stones. Centered in the middle of the pit is a black-robed figure standing before a dark-paneled covered wagon. You also see a narrow opening in the back of the purple silk pavilion. Obvious paths: none

l in wag In the covered wagon: other (3): a dark green emerald cloakpin, a smooth greenish-black Luukos symbol, a slender dark green vial. weapon (1): a black-bladed ritual dagger with a deep green serpent hilt. jewelry (2): a small green snake-shaped amulet, a crude green steel snake talisman. clothing (2): a pair of serpent-toed black boots, a pair of emerald-knuckled black gloves. uncommon,weapon (1): a night black orase runestaff coiled with two glistening green serpents.

l bann The white cloth banners stir faintly, each one depicting a colorful and detailed depiction of a beautiful landscape, from crisp snowy mountains to lush river valleys.

l behind ban Behind the white banners you see a narrow opening.

go open [The Snake Pit - ] Behind the deep purple pavilion, a sand-filled pit has been enclosed within a border of smooth onyx stones. Centered in the middle of the pit is a black-robed figure standing before a dark-paneled covered wagon. You also see a narrow opening in the back of the purple silk pavilion. Obvious paths: none

l in wag In the covered wagon: other (3): a dark green emerald cloakpin, a smooth greenish-black Luukos symbol, a slender dark green vial. weapon (1): a black-bladed ritual dagger with a deep green serpent hilt. jewelry (2): a small green snake-shaped amulet, a crude green steel snake talisman. clothing (2): a pair of serpent-toed black boots, a pair of emerald-knuckled black gloves. uncommon,weapon (1): a night black orase runestaff coiled with two glistening green serpents.

Oh nice! Thanks for this, I'll check it out tonight... hoping that those boots and gloves are acid flaring UAC...

Luxelle
Monday, August 7th, 2017, 8:23:46 PM

In the gilt-hued case you see a small granite triangle, a polished bronze square and a smooth red crystal.

The magic things in the case in the Wayback Wagon ARE magical, but don't do what you hope they will. All of them can be worn, though.

The small granite triangle contains a few charges of Blink.

The smooth red crystal contains several charges of Flaming Aura.

The polished bronze square has several charges of Iron Skin
